intro: Ourouparia setiloba, commonly known as the silky tree, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant is notable for its unique, silky-haired leaves and its ability to thrive in tropical climates. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
